review: Easy to set up, issues with wifi staying connected, changed router channel to 10, seemed to work.  Some slowness with DSL but tolerable for the 39$
author: Alison Page

review: I was already an Amazon Prime member, and the Fire TV Stick came already configured with my account information. All I had to do was give it the pass phrase for my local WiFi network.My only complaint was it took me a while to figure out how to navigate the online menus with the remote - but perhaps most folks would have known that the ring at the top of the remote were the "nav" buttons, while the center of the ring was the "select" button.One feature I really like is that once you pause a movie, after a little while the Fire TV Stick begins to display pictures sort of like a screen saver. I've got my Fire TV Stick connected to an input on my home theater receiver, and the changing display keeps that input active on my receiver even when I leave a movie paused for 30 minutes.I've only used the Fire TV Stick to access Amazon Prime TV/Movies so far - but that was why I bought it.
author: Hardy
